intro: Pouzolzia phenacoides, commonly known as the rock nettle, is a flowering plant native to arid and rocky regions of southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in coastal and mountainous areas, often on limestone or sandy soils. The plant features small, green, ovate leaves with a hairy texture and produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers. It is adapted to withstand drought and high salinity, making it a resilient species in harsh environments. The plant's unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
